Results of International Signature Campaign Published 
    Pyongyang, March 7 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea published the first results of the one-million international signature campaign for the settlement of the issue of "comfort women" on Feb. 28, south Korean MBC reported.
 It stated that as of the end of February, at least 109,000 people had participated in the one-million international signature campaign for demanding an apology and compensation to the victims to the drafting of "comfort women" for the imperial Japanese army and opposing Japan's bid for a permanent membership of the UN Security Council, which began in November last year.    
 It declared that it would transfer the materials on the first signature campaign to the International Labor Organization and continue to fight till August in demand of an apology and compensation for the drafting of "comfort women".

articles.content:
Report from Construction Site of Taean Friendship Glass Factory 
    Pyongyang, March 7 (KCNA) -- The builders of the Taean Friendship Glass Factory have finished qualitatively the concrete tamping of the body frames of the settling basin, the circulating water pond and the silica sand pumping station and other setups of the sand screening system and completed the construction of the industrial water purification ground.
 With the completion of the concrete tamping of the vast sand screening system, a breakthrough has been made for increasing the speed of construction.    
 Some time ago, the builders entered into the assembling of the steel structure of the melting shop, one of the basic production processes.

articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Czech Charge d'Affaires
    Pyongyang, March 7 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met with Czech Charge d'Affaires in Pyongyang Miroslav Podhajsky who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 A conversation proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.    
 On hand was Deputy to the SPA Hong So Hon, who is chairman of the DPRK-Czech Friendship Parliamentary Group.
